thread.title: Wildfire temporarily closes I-15 near Scipio
thread.title_full: Wildfire temporarily closes I-15 near Scipio

title: Wildfire temporarily closes I-15 near Scipio
text:
By Cassidy Hansen , Deseret News Published: Friday, July 3 2015 10:30 p.m. MDT Updated: 1 hour ago Flames are spotted along the I-15 freeway near Scipio on Friday, July 3, 2015. Quinn Rollins View 3 photos » Summary 
A 300-acre wildfire forced the temporary closure of I-15 in both directions Friday evening about 2 miles south of Scipio. 
SCIPIO, Millard County — A 300-acre wildfire forced the temporary closure of I-15 in both directions Friday evening about 2 miles south of Scipio. 
The fire was caused by a lightning strike about 7 p.m. Crews using both fire engines and planes worked to slow the blaze from reaching power lines using water and fire retardant, fire officials said. 
No homes were threatened by the fire, but the flames were right next to the freeway at times. Crews were able to open up the northbound lane of I-15 about 45 minutes later, with southbound I-15 opening 40 minutes after that. 
The blaze is one of the state's first big fires of the season. Fire officials have dubbed it the Scipio Summit Fire. 
— Cassidy Hansen
